description: From German Wismuth, from Middle High German wismāt, from Latin bisemūtum, from Arabic بِسِيمُوتِيُّون‎ (bisīmūtiyyūn), from Ancient Greek ψιμύθιον (psimúthion, “white lead”).

entries.meaning: A chemical element (symbol Bi) with an atomic number of 83: a brittle silvery-white metal.
(countable) A single atom of this element.
